title: Dolphins at Daybreak
blurb: Test your comprehension of Magic Tree House #9: Dolphins at Daybreak. Questions focus on understanding the story, characters, and key events to show proof of reading.

vocab.definition: A scientist who studies ocean life and sea creatures
A smart sea mammal that breathes air and lives in groups
A boat that can travel underwater
An underwater area with coral and many sea creatures
Moving water in the ocean that flows in one direction
To save someone or something from danger
Careful study to learn new facts about something
To share ideas or feelings with others

teachingNotes: This lesson tests reading comprehension of Magic Tree House #9: Dolphins at Daybreak. Students should have read the book before attempting these questions. Focus on story recall, character understanding, and plot sequence. Encourage students to refer back to the book if needed. Key themes include ocean life, friendship, helping others, and learning about marine science.

sample.question: Who are the main characters in this story?
What kind of tree house do Jack and Annie use?
Where does the magic tree house take Jack and Annie?
What sea animal helps Jack and Annie?
Who is the person they meet underwater?
How do Jack and Annie breathe underwater?

truefalse.question: Jack and Annie travel to a coral reef.
The dolphins in the story are mean and dangerous.
Henry is a marine biologist who studies ocean life.
Jack and Annie use scuba gear to breathe underwater.
The magic tree house can take them to different places and times.
Jack always forgets to bring his notebook.
The dolphins communicate with Jack and Annie.

multiplechoice.question: What does Jack always carry with him?
What kind of scientist is Henry?
How do the dolphins help Jack and Annie?
What is special about the tree house?
Where do Jack and Annie live?
What do the dolphins use to communicate?

fillintheblank.question: Jack always brings his ________ to write down important things.
________ are smart sea animals that can communicate with sounds.
Henry is a marine ________ who studies ocean life.
The magic ________ house takes Jack and Annie on adventures.
Jack and Annie travel to a colorful ________ reef under the ocean.
The dolphins help Jack and Annie by showing them the ________ to go.
Jack and Annie can breathe underwater because of the tree house ________.

shortanswer.question: Why do you think the dolphins wanted to help Jack and Annie?
What did Jack and Annie learn about dolphins in this story?
How is Henry's job as a marine biologist important?
expectedAny: he teaches others about the ocean

shortanswer.question: What would you do if you could visit a coral reef like Jack and Annie?
Why do you think Jack writes things down in his notebook?
What makes this Magic Tree House adventure different from staying on land?
How do you think Jack and Annie felt when they first saw the dolphins?
